reasoning: The critique targets the essay’s standing assumption that “mostly-great futures are a narrow target” (imported from the prior essay). That assumption is fairly central because much of the essay’s pessimism/structure (convergence needed, trade/threats mattering, ‘coincidence’ worries) is conditional on no-easy-eutopia/narrow-target being true. However, the essay is also explicitly framed as a follow-up and repeatedly signals conditionality (“if no easy eutopia is true”), so the position isn’t straightforwardly presented as an independent argument for narrow-targetness. As a result, pointing out the lack of re-derivation here only modestly weakens the essay rather than refuting it. The critique is mostly correct that the essay doesn’t independently defend the premise, but it overstates with ‘wholly dependent’/‘as if established fact’ given the essay’s explicit reliance on the previous work and conditional phrasing. Clear, focused, and with little fluff.
title: The narrow target assumption is imported without independent justification
